column5: the condoms dont lie! lol

I was a off topic on my last post: I need new line for my ice rods, other than that I'm pretty good for this year.  It's not going to happen this year, but I'd like to build an ice shack and place it on the lake down my gravel road; sure would make it easy to fish for a couple hours without having to haul all kinds of gear every time I want to go out.

Great price Let us know if they work well. Well the mailman dropped off the new purchase yesterday.  It doesn't come with any instructions, however I'm sure most of us can figure out the star drag, clicker button and spool drag without to much difficulty. The spool has the tiniest amount of wobble, nothing I'm worried about.  To engage free spool, push in the side gold button, to retrieve, just crank, instant anti reverse.  I put a 110yd pony spool of 6lb mono on, lots of room left over.   One turn of the crank retrieves 16 inches of line.  I pulled line a couple of times with different drag settings, seems to come off smooth.  Then I put on the smallest snap swivel, free spool and down it goes.  Added the tiniest split shot and it takes right off.  This was done inside.  I took the spool off, there's no grease in there to get stiff and slow things down in freezing temps.  So far so good, wait and see how it performs with a perch on the other end.
sounds like it will do the job, and a real good price

It's not really for ice fishing but I could use it if I wanted. I'm in the middle of designing and building a large komatik to haul my building materials in to my cabin site. The size will be just under 4' wide and 12' long.  My new planer and belt sander should come in handy.  I'll post pics when I get it built.
Here's a couple more ideas I found: http://i1359.photobucket.com/albums/q781/Deryl-v/IMG_2022_zpscdf587a9.jpg and http://i625.photobucket.com/albums/tt331/431-sigs/PC030005.jpg

Here's a couple more ideas I found: http://i1359.photobucket.com/albums/q781/Deryl-v/IMG_2022_zpscdf587a9.jpg and http://i625.photobucket.com/albums/tt331/431-sigs/PC030005.jpg  Think I seen the same thing . LOL
I bought a lund for dodging ice bergs on the niagara

Well the mailman dropped off the new purchase yesterday.  It doesn't come with any instructions, however I'm sure most of us can figure out the star drag, clicker button and spool drag without to much difficulty. The spool has the tiniest amount of wobble, nothing I'm worried about.  To engage free spool, push in the side gold button, to retrieve, just crank, instant anti reverse.  I put a 110yd pony spool of 6lb mono on, lots of room left over.   One turn of the crank retrieves 16 inches of line. So far so good, wait and see how it performs with a perch on the other end.   when you hold the reel on an angle, spool face towards the ground, does the spool slip off and go into free spool?  that's the biggest piss off about my black betty, and the price sucked for what you get...glad to see some cheaper competitor options, the freespool feature got me bites
I picked up a Clam Bigfoot XL2000 on Sunday for 20% off and some extra ice anchors and the drill bit adaptor for $318.xx out the door when the hut was $329.99 + taxes.  Cannot wait to use it.

when you hold the reel on an angle, spool face towards the ground, does the spool slip off and go into free spool?  that's the biggest piss off about my black betty, and the price sucked for what you get...glad to see some cheaper competitor options, the freespool feature got me bites Never tried holding it with spool towards the ground, I'll do a thorough check when I get home and report back.

Lets see, A new Black Betty had one last year and it turned into my go to reel. New ATV with greater ground clearance.. Hopefully Wayne won't have to pull me out of deep snow this year.  Now if the boss will just let me have the time off.
Never seen those Black Betty reels before. They look interesting and a possible purchase. Is there anywhere to buy them in Ontario? Quickme: You're going to love the Titans.
Sail has them.

my brand new shack got broken into, used as a brothel, and i lost my heater and two propane tanks. just to be nice they smashed out the windows, ripped off the door and smashed a hole through the wall  oh and some needles on the floor just for decoration
A brothel, lol!!!!

when you hold the reel on an angle, spool face towards the ground, does the spool slip off and go into free spool?  that's the biggest piss off about my black betty, and the price sucked for what you get...glad to see some cheaper competitor options, the freespool feature got me bites Well I tried every conceivable position, rattle, shook, caressed, fondled, nope, the spool doesn't go into free spool.
I did the same with my black betty and could not get it to do it
Thank God Terry... or you'd want to return it to the point of purchase...

hmm, i warrantied mine right out of the box, the new one does the same thing....they told me that's how it was...  I've used the reel and like the freespool function, but has a tendency to slip into freespool when it shouldn't, ie right before i set the hook...left hand retrieve, so when I hold rod with my right hand, the spool naturally faces the ground
Is yours the regular Black Betty or the 6061 bare foot?
6061  I was on the preorder list from reeds in the US...with shipping and duty, I really wish I waited for them to hit local stores first lol
The new 2015 model?? or the older 2014?  Dang... now I've got to go back out in the shop and play with the 3 I have out there.. lol
older model, bought it the first month they came out, I warrantied immediately and same issue  guess I need to check out their website, did they change much on the new model?
They enclosed it for 2015.. which I don't like and why I jumped through hoops to find some left hand '14's

Just seeing who's getting the itch yet. I've got it pretty bad but the snow and Monday is turning me off just a bit.  So far I've done: Painted some glow in the dark paint to my panfish rods to become better at bite detection during low light conditions. Haven't made any big purchases yet this year after last year's splurging, but am looking at a hard rod case potentially. And lastly bought myself my very first tipup.  Let's hear from you guys

I am CHOMPING at the bit to get out. If I had the money, I would do up a whole new Lake Trout combo with a heavy 32" ugly stick, Pfluger president reel, 10 pound braid with an 8 pound fluro leader. Alas I don't have that kinda money so it'll probably just be the line I add to my old combo.  Debating selling my flip over for a pop up but that's small potatoes. Also debating modifying a live target bait ball to be a jigging lure under the ice. If it works I'll post pics.  Mostly just countin the days and waiting for Chad or Joey to mention that the ice is thick up there so I can start scouting.
Getting the Bravo seat re-uphosltered then plan to mount it back on me skidoooo.  Otherwise might need some minnows come March when ice fishing will likely begin this year.
Slooooowly building a smitty sled Bought  a couple of black bettys to try Dropped off the boat for winter storage and picked up the skidoo Bought an ATV

got a Lowrance Elite 5dhi and upgraded the battery to a 12v 12ah monster.  Also added a adapter that I can charge my phone/GPS with.   Bought a pair of Baffin Titans for the hardwater season also.  Really looking forward to the lake freezing over!
Have one of these on order, lot cheaper than the Black Betty.  http://www.fishusa.com/Product/No-8-Tackle-Cold-Gear-Inline-Ice-Reels?utm_source=flyer&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=flyer2014-11-4
I ordered two 2014 black betty 6061 to try.  Their being cleared out for 49.99 at gander mountain. After a code 90 shipped to a holding company.

Debating selling my flip over for a pop up  i wouldnt ,pop ups canbbe a real pain in the ass....especially in the wind by yourself
Great price Let us know if they work well.
Also picked up a Clam 1660 thermal from the states. Switching from a command post style hub.

Picked up a set of snowshoes, hopefully that will make getting out on the lake easier when the snow gets deep.  Looking for a good leather (like deer or elk hide) aviator hat with real fur lining.....  Burt
I bought a big bottle of Jagermeister
I bought a big bottle of Jagermeister Awesome stuff.
Going to fish quinte this winter and heard they like red so I taped red reflective tape to my spoons.  Hopefully I can land one big one this year.

Going to fish quinte this winter and heard they like red so I taped red reflective tape to my spoons.  Hopefully I can land one big one this year.  That's on my list this year as well. I have to back up a statement that it takes 8 man hours to figure out how to catch a single walleye from there. I've only got 4 left. lol.
I couldnt wait any longer so I decided to go rumfishing in Barbados.

I got the bugs a few weeks ago, just after my last goose hunt.  I even set up my 4 person Clam ice hut in my basement and stared at it.  To help with the itch I have been tying some ice jigs, mostly for perch.  I also finished an order of jigs for a collegue of mine to give to her father in law in Timmins.

Jiffy Auger cover, so I can stop fighting to get the snow out of my engine when I arrive at my spot, and a couple new spare auger blade cover rubber straps. Oh.. and a few Black Betty 6061's to spool up and put to work. Really liked using them last year when I dropped in on Lloyd a few times from the air... We'll see how I like them after hammering them around in the hut for awhile, compared to my old arsenal of spinning reels. Might need a battery for the sled... but it did start !
HMMMMM, Terry,did you check your sled   Still working on my creation. 60% there.
Fisherman - that's an awesome reel - & at a good price.  I paid 100 bux for black betty last winter GRRRR!
Someone's got it figured out!  I dug out my wooden sticks, made up a couple batches of medium and large sized salties, and put some gas in the sled!
After using my cousin's side by side with tracks last year I decided to get a set for my quad.  Just put them on this past weekend and now looking forward to some back lake action.

Didn't we fish in 3" last year? Hahaha. I know a good lake, super easy access with very few if any fisherman that has lots of 24-30" pike. That could be a fun one to start  I'm hoping for more laker fishing, but will certainly target walleye in Nipissing and pike on other lakes for fun.

Didn't we fish in 3" last year? Hahaha. I know a good lake, super easy access with very few if any fisherman that has lots of 24-30" pike. That could be a fun one to start  I'm hoping for more laker fishing, but will certainly target walleye in Nipissing and pike on other lakes for fun.   Chad, 3" were the thick spots. Hahaha. I'm good to go as soon as it locks up there. I'll be out of work in 2-3 weeks anyways.  I've got one spot I want to scout for lakers and another that Chris showed me that is dynamite for guys under 5 pounds. If you don't mind traveling down the 11 for an hour or two I'd be happy to share it.

Jiffy Auger cover, so I can stop fighting to get the snow out of my engine when I arrive at my spot, and a couple new spare auger blade cover rubber straps. We'll see how I like them after hammering them around in the hut for awhile, compared to my old arsenal of spinning reels. Might need a battery for the sled... but it did start ! Nothing like being frugal,  how about a couple of feet of 5/16 or 3/8ths bunjey cord, a double overhand knot at each end.  I thing mines about 10 years old now.
